field.label: Enabled
field.help: This will enable or disable the group filters.

field.help: Unique number for group.

field.label: Auth port
field.help: Maps IP Ports to this filter group.

field.label: Auth IP
field.help: Maps client IPs to this filter group. Examples: 192.168.0.2, 192.168.2.0/24

field.label: Naughtyness limit
field.help: This the limit over which the page will be blocked. Each weighted phrase is given a value either positive or negative and the values added up. Phrases to do with good subjects will have negative values, and bad subjects will have positive values. See the weightedphraselist file for examples. As a guide: 60 is for young children, 100 for old children, 160 for young adults.

field.label: SSL man in the middle
field.help: Forge ssl certificates for all non-exception sites, decrypt the data then re encrypt it using a different private key. Used to filter ssl sites

field.label: Enable MITM site certificate checking
field.help: Ignored if SSL man in the middle is off.

field.label: Enable SSL support
field.help: Auto switch to MITM with upstream connection error or to deliver block page ignored if sslmitm is off. To revert to v4 type behavour switch this off. Default is 'on'

field.label: Enable Deep URL Analysis
field.help: When enabled, E2 looks for URLs within URLs, checking against the bannedsitelist and bannedurllist. This can be used, for example, to block images originating from banned sites from appearing in Google Images search results, as the original URLs are embedded in the thumbnail GET requests.

field.label: Banned search list
field.help: Words must be in alphabetic order within a single line and separated by a '+' sign. All combinations of the words will be blocked e.g. girl+naughty will block naughty+girl as well as girl+naughty

field.label: URL modifying Regular Expressions
field.help: Used to modify url on the fly use to enforce safe search etc. Do not try and change target site - use redirect for this.

field.label: URL redirect Regular Expressions
field.help: Used to redirect browser to different site and or url. 'regexp_pattern'->'url_to_redirect_to'

field.label: Banned phrase list
field.help:
Examples:
< test> will match any word with the string 'test' at the beginning.
<test > will match any word with the string 'test' at the end.
<test> will match any word with the string 'test' at any point in the word.
< test > will match only the word 'test'.
<this is a test phrase> will match that exact phrase.
<test>,<secondtest> will match if both words are found in the page.
A combination of the above can also be used eg < test>,<secondtest>

field.label: Exception phrase list
field.help:
Examples:
If any of the phrases listed below appear in a web page
then it will bypass the filtering and be allowed through
eg < medical >
Unblock the page if the following phrases are found on the same page. Each line is a new combination.
eg
<education>,<biology>,<medical>

field.label: Weighted phrase list
field.help:
Examples:
<slut><10> - Adds 10 to the count against the string 'slut'. ie. sluts, slut!, abslutxyz.
< slut ><10> - Adds 10 to the count against the word 'slut'. ie. Sally is a slut that smells.
<slut>,<horny><50> - Adds 50 to the count when the strings 'slut' and 'horny' are found on the same page.
<breast>,<medical><-30> - Subtracts 30 from the count when 'breast' and 'medical' are on the one page.
<education><-25> - Subtracts 25 from the count when 'education' is on the page.
